titleInfo.title: PROVIDING FOR CONSIDERATION OF THE SENATE AMENDMENT TO H.R. 2028, ENERGY AND WATER DEVELOPMENT AND RELATED AGENCIES APPROPRIATIONS ACT, 2016, AND PROVIDING FOR CONSIDERATION OF S. 612, GEORGE P...

extension.searchTitle: PROVIDING FOR CONSIDERATION OF THE SENATE AMENDMENT TO H.R. 2028, ENERGY AND WATER DEVELOPMENT AND RELATED AGENCIES APPROPRIATIONS ACT, 2016, AND PROVIDING FOR CONSIDERATION OF S. 612, GEORGE P...; Congressional Record Vol. 162, No. 177

congVote.result: So the previous question was ordered.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory1: Energy and Water Development and Related Agencies Appropriations Act, 2016
Designating the Federal building and United States courthouse located at 1300 Victoria Street in Laredo, Texas, as the ``George P. Kazen Federal Building and United States Courthouse''
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: Pursuant to H. Res. 949, the House concurred in the Senate amendment to H.R. 2028, making appropriations for energy and water development and related agencies for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2016, with an amendment consisting of the text of Rules Committee Print 114-70, modified by the amendment printed in H. Rept. 114-849, by a yea-and-nay vote of 326 yeas to 96 nays, Roll No. 620.<P/>H. Res. 949, the rule providing for consideration of the Senate amendment to the bill (H.R. 2028) and providing for consideration of the bill (S. 612) was agreed to by a yea-and-nay vote of 235 yeas to 180 nays, Roll No. 618, after the previous question was ordered by a yea-and-nay vote of 234 yeas to 181 nays, Roll No. 617.

The House passed S. 612, to designate the Federal building and United States courthouse located at 1300 Victoria Street in Laredo, Texas, as the �D1116�``George P. Kazen Federal Building and United States Courthouse'', by a recorded vote of 360 ayes to 61 noes, Roll No. 622.<P/>Rejected the Doyle motion to recommit the bill to the Committee on Energy and Commerce with instructions to report the same back to the House forthwith with an amendment, by a yea-and-nay vote of 184 yeas to 236 nays, Roll No. 621.<P/>Pursuant to the Rule, an amendment in the nature of a substitute consisting of the text of Rules Committee Print 114-69 shall be considered as adopted.<P/>H. Res. 949, the rule providing for consideration of the Senate amendment to the bill (H.R. 2028) and providing for consideration of the bill (S. 612) was agreed to by a yea-and-nay vote of 235 yeas to 180 nays, Roll No. 618, after the previous question was ordered by a yea-and-nay vote of 234 yeas to 181 nays, Roll No. 617.

congVote.result: So the resolution was agreed to.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory1: Energy and Water Development and Related Agencies Appropriations Act, 2016
Designating the Federal building and United States courthouse located at 1300 Victoria Street in Laredo, Texas, as the ``George P. Kazen Federal Building and United States Courthouse''
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: Pursuant to H. Res. 949, the House concurred in the Senate amendment to H.R. 2028, making appropriations for energy and water development and related agencies for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2016, with an amendment consisting of the text of Rules Committee Print 114-70, modified by the amendment printed in H. Rept. 114-849, by a yea-and-nay vote of 326 yeas to 96 nays, Roll No. 620.<P/>H. Res. 949, the rule providing for consideration of the Senate amendment to the bill (H.R. 2028) and providing for consideration of the bill (S. 612) was agreed to by a yea-and-nay vote of 235 yeas to 180 nays, Roll No. 618, after the previous question was ordered by a yea-and-nay vote of 234 yeas to 181 nays, Roll No. 617.

The House passed S. 612, to designate the Federal building and United States courthouse located at 1300 Victoria Street in Laredo, Texas, as the �D1116�``George P. Kazen Federal Building and United States Courthouse'', by a recorded vote of 360 ayes to 61 noes, Roll No. 622.<P/>Rejected the Doyle motion to recommit the bill to the Committee on Energy and Commerce with instructions to report the same back to the House forthwith with an amendment, by a yea-and-nay vote of 184 yeas to 236 nays, Roll No. 621.<P/>Pursuant to the Rule, an amendment in the nature of a substitute consisting of the text of Rules Committee Print 114-69 shall be considered as adopted.<P/>H. Res. 949, the rule providing for consideration of the Senate amendment to the bill (H.R. 2028) and providing for consideration of the bill (S. 612) was agreed to by a yea-and-nay vote of 235 yeas to 180 nays, Roll No. 618, after the previous question was ordered by a yea-and-nay vote of 234 yeas to 181 nays, Roll No. 617.

extension.searchTitle: KEVIN AND AVONTE'S LAW OF 2016; Congressional Record Vol. 162, No. 177

congVote.result: So (two-thirds being in the affirmative) the rules were suspended and the bill, as amended, was passed.
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to suspend the rules and pass the following measure which was debated on Wednesday, December 7th:<P/>H.R. 4919, amended, to amend the Violent Crime Control and Law Enforcement Act of 1994, to reauthorize the Missing Alzheimer's Disease Patient Alert Program, and to promote initiatives that will reduce the risk of injury and death relating to the wandering characteristics of some children with autism, by a \2/3\ yea-and-nay vote of 346 yeas to 66 nays, Roll No. 619.

extension.searchTitle: ENERGY AND WATER DEVELOPMENT AND RELATED AGENCIES APPROPRIATIONS ACT, 2016; Congressional Record Vol. 162, No. 177

congVote.result: So the motion to concur was agreed to.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory1: Energy and Water Development and Related Agencies Appropriations Act, 2016
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: Pursuant to H. Res. 949, the House concurred in the Senate amendment to H.R. 2028, making appropriations for energy and water development and related agencies for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2016, with an amendment consisting of the text of Rules Committee Print 114-70, modified by the amendment printed in H. Rept. 114-849, by a yea-and-nay vote of 326 yeas to 96 nays, Roll No. 620.

extension.searchTitle: GEORGE P. KAZEN FEDERAL BUILDING AND UNITED STATES COURTHOUSE; Congressional Record Vol. 162, No. 177

congVote.result: So the motion to recommit was rejected.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory1: Designating the Federal building and United States courthouse located at 1300 Victoria Street in Laredo, Texas, as the ``George P. Kazen Federal Building and United States Courthouse''
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House passed S. 612, to designate the Federal building and United States courthouse located at 1300 Victoria Street in Laredo, Texas, as the �D1116�``George P. Kazen Federal Building and United States Courthouse'', by a recorded vote of 360 ayes to 61 noes, Roll No. 622.<P/>Rejected the Doyle motion to recommit the bill to the Committee on Energy and Commerce with instructions to report the same back to the House forthwith with an amendment, by a yea-and-nay vote of 184 yeas to 236 nays, Roll No. 621.

congVote.dailyDigestCategory1: Designating the Federal building and United States courthouse located at 1300 Victoria Street in Laredo, Texas, as the ``George P. Kazen Federal Building and United States Courthouse''
Designating the Federal building and United States courthouse located at 1300 Victoria Street in Laredo, Texas, as the ``George P. Kazen Federal Building and United States Courthouse''
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House passed S. 612, to designate the Federal building and United States courthouse located at 1300 Victoria Street in Laredo, Texas, as the �D1116�``George P. Kazen Federal Building and United States Courthouse'', by a recorded vote of 360 ayes to 61 noes, Roll No. 622.

The House passed S. 612, to designate the Federal building and United States courthouse located at 1300 Victoria Street in Laredo, Texas, as the �D1116�``George P. Kazen Federal Building and United States Courthouse'', by a recorded vote of 360 ayes to 61 noes, Roll No. 622.<P/>Rejected the Doyle motion to recommit the bill to the Committee on Energy and Commerce with instructions to report the same back to the House forthwith with an amendment, by a yea-and-nay vote of 184 yeas to 236 nays, Roll No. 621.

congVote.result: The conference report was agreed to
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: <P/>: By 92 yeas to 7 nays (Vote No. 159), Senate agreed to the conference report to accompany S. 2943, to authorize appropriations for fiscal year 2017 for military activities of the Department of Defense, for military construction, and for defense activities of the Department of Energy, to prescribe military personnel strengths for such fiscal year.
